abstract: The Appraisal column; New York City's Landmarks Preservation commission is set to consider whether to expand Douglaston, Queens, historic district to include several buildings known collectively as the Douglaston extension; pushback from property owners and clashes over benefits and drawbacks of landmark status have slowed commission's actions.
lead_paragraph: The White family’s 1865 farmhouse in Douglaston, Queens, was once condemned to make way for a road. Now, decades later, it may be designated as a landmark as the city seeks to expand a historic district.

headline.main: Locking Horns Over Preservation and Property Rights in Queens
headline.print_headline: Neighbors in Queens Lock Horns Over Preservation and Property Rights

snippet: The White family’s 1865 farmhouse in Douglaston, Queens, was once condemned to make way for a road. Now, decades later, it may be designated as a landmark as the city seeks to expand a historic district.
